title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: Install development version allodb GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/allodb")

title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: Prior calculating tree biomass using allodb, users need provide table (.e. dataframe) DBH (cm), parsed species Latin names, site(s) coordinates. following examples use data Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute, USA (SCBI) ForestGEO dynamics plot (1st census 2008, trees 1 hectare). Data can requested ForestGEO portal (https://forestgeo.si.edu/)
code: require(allodb) #> Loading required package: allodb data(scbi_stem1) str(scbi_stem1) #> Classes 'tbl_df', 'tbl' and 'data.frame':    2287 obs. of  6 variables: #>  $ treeID : int  2695 1229 1230 1295 1229 66 2600 4936 1229 1005 ... #>  $ stemID : int  2695 38557 1230 32303 32273 31258 2600 4936 36996 1005 ... #>  $ dbh    : num  1.41 1.67 1.42 1.04 2.47 ... #>  $ genus  : chr  "Acer" "Acer" "Acer" "Acer" ... #>  $ species: chr  "negundo" "negundo" "negundo" "negundo" ... #>  $ Family : chr  "Sapindaceae" "Sapindaceae" "Sapindaceae" "Sapindaceae" ...

what: Load and modify the equation table
title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: allodb provides dataframe containing 570 parsed allometric equations. Additional information equation table can found equation metadata. equation table default functions package. Users can modify set equations used estimate biomass using new_equations() function: users can work subset equations, add new equations table (see ?allodb::new_equations). customized equation table provided argument get_biomass() () function (argument name: new_eqtable).
code: data(equations) data(equations_metadata)

previous_headings: Load and modify the equation table
title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
code: show_cols <- c("equation_id", "equation_taxa", "equation_allometry") eq_tab_acer <- new_equations(subset_taxa = "Acer") head(eq_tab_acer[, show_cols]) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   equation_id equation_taxa       equation_allometry                             #>   <chr>       <chr>               <chr>                                          #> 1 a4e4d1      Acer saccharum      exp(-2.192-0.011*dbh+2.67*(log(dbh)))          #> 2 dfc2c7      Acer rubrum         2.02338*(dbh^2)^1.27612                        #> 3 eac63e      Acer rubrum         5.2879*(dbh^2)^1.07581                         #> 4 f49bcb      Acer pseudoplatanus exp(-5.644074+(2.5189*(log(pi*dbh))))          #> 5 14bf3d      Acer mandshuricum   0.0335*(dbh)^1.606+0.0026*(dbh)^3.323+0.1222*… #> 6 0c7cd6      Acer mono           0.0202*(dbh)^1.810+0.0111*(dbh)^2.740+0.1156*…

previous_headings: Load and modify the equation table
title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
code: eq_tab_add <- new_equations(   new_taxa = c("Quercus ilex", "Castanea sativa"),   new_allometry = c("0.12*dbh^2.5", "0.15*dbh^2.7"),   new_coords = c(4, 44),   new_min_dbh = c(5, 10),   new_max_dbh = c(35, 68),   new_sample_size = c(143, 62) ) ## show added equations - they contain "new" in their equation_id head(eq_tab_add[grepl("new", eq_tab_add$equation_id), ]) #> # A tibble: 2 × 15 #>   equation_id equation_taxa   equation_allometry independent_variable #>   <chr>       <chr>           <chr>              <chr>                #> 1 new1        Quercus ilex    0.12*dbh^2.5       DBH                  #> 2 new2        Castanea sativa 0.15*dbh^2.7       DBH                  #> # ℹ 11 more variables: dependent_variable <chr>, long <chr>, lat <chr>, #> #   koppen <chr>, dbh_min_cm <dbl>, dbh_max_cm <dbl>, sample_size <dbl>, #> #   dbh_units_original <chr>, dbh_unit_cf <dbl>, output_units_original <chr>, #> #   output_units_cf <dbl>

title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: aboveground biomass (AGB) can estimated using get_biomass() function: required arguments diameter breast height (DBH, cm), taxonomic identification (genus species level), location (long-lat coordinates). output aboveground biomass tree kg. get_biomass() function can also used estimate AGB trees one (several) censuses.
code: get_biomass(   dbh = 50,   genus = "liriodendron",   species = "tulipifera",   coords = c(-78.2, 38.9) ) #> [1] 1578.644 scbi_stem1$agb <-   get_biomass(     dbh = scbi_stem1$dbh,     genus = scbi_stem1$genus,     species = scbi_stem1$species,     coords = c(-78.2, 38.9)   ) plot(   x = scbi_stem1$dbh,   y = scbi_stem1$agb,   col = factor(scbi_stem1$genus),   xlab = "DBH (cm)",   ylab = "AGB (kg)" )

what: Attribute a weight to each equation in the equation table for each taxon/location combination
title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: Within get_biomass() function, new allometric equations calibrated taxon/location combinations user-provided dataframe. done attributing weight equation equation table, based sampling size, taxonomic climatic similarity taxon/location combination considered.
code: allom_weights <-   weight_allom(     genus = "Acer",     species = "rubrum",     coords = c(-78, 38)   )  ## visualize weights equ_tab_acer <- new_equations() equ_tab_acer$weights <- allom_weights keep_cols <-   c(     "equation_id",     "equation_taxa",     "sample_size",     "weights"   ) order_weights <- order(equ_tab_acer$weights, decreasing = TRUE) equ_tab_acer <- equ_tab_acer[order_weights, keep_cols] head(equ_tab_acer) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   equation_id equation_taxa        sample_size weights #>   <chr>       <chr>                      <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 138258      Acer rubrum                  150   0.415 #> 2 d6be5c      Sapindaceae                  243   0.383 #> 3 a2fbbb      Sapindaceae                  200   0.349 #> 4 2630d5      Trees (Angiosperms)          886   0.299 #> 5 d4c590      Trees (Angiosperms)          549   0.289 #> 6 ed748f      Broad-leaved species        2223   0.270

title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: Equations resampled within original DBH range: number resampled values equation proportional weight (attributed weight_allom() function).
code: df_resample <-   resample_agb(     genus = "Acer",     species = "rubrum",     coords = c(-78, 38),     nres = 1e4   )  plot(   df_resample$dbh,   df_resample$agb,   xlab = "DBH (cm)",   ylab = "Resampled AGB values (kg)" )

what: Calibrate a new equation for each taxon/location combination
title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: resampled values used fit following nonlinear model: \(AGB = \cdot dbh ^ b + e\), ..d. \(e \sim \mathcal{N}(0, sigma^2)\). parameters (, b, sigma) returned est_params() function. words, function calibrates new allometric equations sampling previous ones. New allometric equations calibrated species location resampling original compiled equations; equations larger sample size, /higher taxonomic rank, climatic similarity species location question given higher weight process.  est_params() function can used species/site combinations dataset . AGB recalculated AGB = * dbh^b within get_biomass() function.
code: pars_acer <- est_params(   genus = "Acer",   species = "rubrum",   coords = c(-78, 38) ) plot(   df_resample$dbh,   df_resample$agb,   xlab = "DBH (cm)",   ylab = "Resampled AGB values (kg)" ) curve(pars_acer$a * x^pars_acer$b,   add = TRUE, col = 2, lwd = 2 ) params <- est_params(   genus = scbi_stem1$genus,   species = scbi_stem1$species,   coords = c(-78.2, 38.9) ) head(params) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   genus       species      long   lat      a     b sigma #>   <chr>       <chr>       <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Acer        negundo     -78.2  38.9 0.0762  2.55  433. #> 2 Acer        rubrum      -78.2  38.9 0.0768  2.55  412. #> 3 Ailanthus   altissima   -78.2  38.9 0.0995  2.48  377. #> 4 Amelanchier arborea     -78.2  38.9 0.0690  2.56  359. #> 5 Asimina     triloba     -78.2  38.9 0.0995  2.48  377. #> 6 Carpinus    caroliniana -78.2  38.9 0.0984  2.48  317.

title: Using allodb to estimate aboveground biomass
text: recalibrated equation one taxon/location combination can easily visualized illustrate_allodb() function, returns ggplot (see package ggplot2) resampled values, top equations used displayed legend. user can control number equations equation information shown legend. red dotted line recalibrated equation used get_biomass() function.
code: illustrate_allodb(   genus = "Acer",   species = "rubrum",   coords = c(-78, 38) ) illustrate_allodb(   genus = "Acer",   species = "rubrum",   coords = c(-78, 38),   neq = 15,   eqinfo = c("equation_taxa", "geographic_area") )

title: Tree Biomass Estimation at Extra-Tropical Forest Plots
text: Allometric equations calculation tree aboveground biomass (AGB) form basis estimates forest carbon storage exchange atmosphere. standard models exist calculate forest biomass across tropics, lack standardized tool computing AGB across global extratropics. allodb conceived framework standardize simplify biomass estimation process across globally distributed extratropical forests (mainly temperate boreal forests). allodb aimed : ) compile relevant published unpublished allometries, focusing AGB structured handle variables (e.g., height); b) objectively select integrate appropriate available equations across full range tree sizes; c) serve platform future updates expansion research sites. allodb package contains dataset systematically selected published allometric equations. dataset built based 701 woody species identified 24 large ForestGEO forest dynamic plots representing major extratropical forest types. total 570 parsed allometric equations estimate individual tree biomass retrieved, checked, combined using weighting function designed ensure optimal equation selection full tree size range smooth transitions across equations. equation dataset used can customized built-functions subset original dataset add new equations. package provides functions estimate tree biomass based user-provided census data (tree diameter, taxonomic identification, plot coordinates). New allometric equations calibrated species location resampling original equations; equations larger sample size /higher taxonomic climatic similarity species location question given higher weight process.

title: Tree Biomass Estimation at Extra-Tropical Forest Plots
text: Install development version allodb GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/allodb")

title: Tree Biomass Estimation at Extra-Tropical Forest Plots
text: Prior calculating tree biomass using allodb, users need provide table (.e. dataframe) DBH (cm), parsed species Latin names, site(s) coordinates. following examples use data Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute, USA (SCBI) ForestGEO dynamics plot (trees 1 hectare surveyed 2008). Full tree census data can requested ForestGEO portal. biomass trees one (several) censuses can estimated using get_biomass function. Biomass single tree can estimated given dbh species identification (results kilograms). Users can modify set equations used estimate biomass using new_equations function. default option entire allodb equation table. Users can also work subset equations, add new equations table (see ?allodb::new_equations). new equation table provided argument get_biomass function. Within get_biomass function, equation table used calibrate new allometric equation species/site combinations user-provided dataframe. done attributing weight equation based sampling size, taxonomic climatic similarity species/site combination considered. Equations resampled within original DBH range: number resampled values equation proportional weight (attributed weight_allom function).  resampled values used fit following nonlinear model: , ..d. . parameters (, b, sigma) returned est_params() function. resampled values (dots) new fitted equation (red dotted line) can visualized illustrate_allodb() function.  est_params function can used species/site combinations dataset . AGB recalculated agb = * dbh^b within get_biomass function. Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.
code: library(allodb) data(scbi_stem1) scbi_stem1$agb <-   get_biomass(     dbh = scbi_stem1$dbh,     genus = scbi_stem1$genus,     species = scbi_stem1$species,     coords = c(-78.2, 38.9)   ) get_biomass(   dbh = 50,   genus = "liriodendron",   species = "tulipifera",   coords = c(-78.2, 38.9) ) #> [1] 1578.644 show_cols <- c("equation_id", "equation_taxa", "equation_allometry") eq_tab_acer <- new_equations(subset_taxa = "Acer") head(eq_tab_acer[, show_cols]) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   equation_id equation_taxa       equation_allometry                             #>   <chr>       <chr>               <chr>                                          #> 1 a4e4d1      Acer saccharum      exp(-2.192-0.011*dbh+2.67*(log(dbh)))          #> 2 dfc2c7      Acer rubrum         2.02338*(dbh^2)^1.27612                        #> 3 eac63e      Acer rubrum         5.2879*(dbh^2)^1.07581                         #> 4 f49bcb      Acer pseudoplatanus exp(-5.644074+(2.5189*(log(pi*dbh))))          #> 5 14bf3d      Acer mandshuricum   0.0335*(dbh)^1.606+0.0026*(dbh)^3.323+0.1222*… #> 6 0c7cd6      Acer mono           0.0202*(dbh)^1.810+0.0111*(dbh)^2.740+0.1156*… allom_weights <-   weight_allom(     genus = "Acer",     species = "rubrum",     coords = c(-78, 38)   )  ## visualize weights equ_tab_acer <- new_equations() equ_tab_acer$weights <- allom_weights keep_cols <-   c(     "equation_id",     "equation_taxa",     "sample_size",     "weights"   ) order_weights <- order(equ_tab_acer$weights, decreasing = TRUE) equ_tab_acer <- equ_tab_acer[order_weights, keep_cols] head(equ_tab_acer) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   equation_id equation_taxa        sample_size weights #>   <chr>       <chr>                      <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 138258      Acer rubrum                  150   0.415 #> 2 d6be5c      Sapindaceae                  243   0.383 #> 3 a2fbbb      Sapindaceae                  200   0.349 #> 4 2630d5      Trees (Angiosperms)          886   0.299 #> 5 d4c590      Trees (Angiosperms)          549   0.289 #> 6 ed748f      Broad-leaved species        2223   0.270 df_resample <-   resample_agb(     genus = "Acer",     species = "rubrum",     coords = c(-78, 38)   )  plot(   df_resample$dbh,   df_resample$agb,   xlab = "DBH (cm)",   ylab = "Resampled AGB values (kg)" ) pars_acer <- est_params(   genus = "Acer",   species = "rubrum",   coords = c(-78, 38) ) illustrate_allodb(   genus = "Acer",   species = "rubrum",   coords = c(-78, 38) ) params <- est_params(   genus = scbi_stem1$genus,   species = scbi_stem1$species,   coords = c(-78.2, 38.9) ) head(params) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   genus       species      long   lat      a     b sigma #>   <chr>       <chr>       <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Acer        negundo     -78.2  38.9 0.0762  2.55  433. #> 2 Acer        rubrum      -78.2  38.9 0.0768  2.55  412. #> 3 Ailanthus   altissima   -78.2  38.9 0.0995  2.48  377. #> 4 Amelanchier arborea     -78.2  38.9 0.0690  2.56  359. #> 5 Asimina     triloba     -78.2  38.9 0.0995  2.48  377. #> 6 Carpinus    caroliniana -78.2  38.9 0.0984  2.48  317.

title: Calibrate new allometric equations — est_params
text: genus character vector, containing genus (e.g. "Quercus") tree. coords numeric vector length 2 longitude latitude (trees measured location) matrix 2 numerical columns giving coordinates tree. species character vector (length genus), containing species (e.g. "rubra")  tree. Default NULL, species identification available. new_eqtable Optional. equation table created new_equations() function. Default compiled allodb equation table. wna numeric vector, parameter used weight_allom() function determine dbh-related sample-size related weights attributed equations without specified dbh range sample size, respectively. Default 0.1. w95 numeric vector, parameter used weight_allom() function determine value sample-size-related weight reaches 95% maximum value (max=1). Default 500. nres number resampled values. Default "1e4".

title: Calibrate new allometric equations — est_params
text: object class "data.frame" fitted coefficients (columns) non-linear least-square regression: $$AGB = * dbh ^ b + e, \space   \mathit{} \space e ~ N(0, sigma^2)$$

title: Compute tree aboveground biomass (AGB) based on allometric equations — get_biomass
text: allodb estimates AGB calibrating new allometric equation taxon (arguments genus  species) location (argument coords) user-provided census data. new allometric equation based set allometric equations can customized using new_eqtable argument. equation given weight weight_allom() function, based : 1) original sample size (numbers trees used develop given allometry), 2) climatic similarity target location, 3) taxonomic similarity target taxon (see documentation weight_allom() function). final weight attributed equation product three weights. Equations resampled theresample_agb() funtion: number samples per equation proportional weight, total number samples provided argument nres. resampling done drawing DBH values uniform distribution DBH range equation, estimating AGB equation. couples values (DBH, AGB) obtained used function est_params() calibrate new allometric equation, applying linear regression log-transformed data. parameters new allometric equations used get_biomass() function back-transforming AGB predictions based user-provided DBHs.

title: Koppen climate classification matrix — koppenMatrix
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 900 rows 3 columns.

title: Koppen climate classification matrix — koppenMatrix
text: value column weight given combination Koppen climates columns zone1 zone2; table symmetric: zone1 zone2 can interchanged. weight calculated 3 steps: (1) main climate group (first letter) , climate weight starts 0.4; one groups "C" (temperate climate) "D" (continental climate), climate weight starts 0.2 2 groups considered similar enough; otherwise, weight 0; (2) equation site belong group, weight incremented additional value 0 0.3 based precipitation pattern similarity (second letter Koppen zone), (3) additional value 0 0.3 based temperature pattern similarity (third letter Koppen zone). resulting weight value 0 (different climate groups) 1 (exactly climate classification).

title: Modify the original equation table — new_equations
text: subset_taxa character vector taxa kept. Default "", case taxa kept. subset_climate character vector Koppen climate classification kept. Default "", case climates kept. subset_region character vector name location(s) country(ies) broader region(s) (eg. "Europe", "North America") kept. Default "", case regions/countries kept. subset_ids character vector equation IDs kept. Default "", case equations kept. subset_output dependent variable(s) provided output? Default "Total aboveground biomass" "Whole tree (stump)", possible values : "Bark biomass", "Branches (dead)", "Branches (live)", "Branches total (live, dead)", "Foliage total", "Height", "Leaves", "Stem (wood )", "Stem biomass", "Stem biomass (bark)", "Stem biomass (without bark)", "Whole tree (belowground)". aware currently equations represent variables, estimated values might accurate. new_taxa character string vector specifying taxon (taxa) allometry calibrated. new_allometry character string allometric equation. new_coords vector matrix coordinates (longitude, latitude) calibration data. new_min_dbh numerical value, minimum DBH equation valid (cm). Default NULL (nothing added). new_max_dbh numerical value, maximum DBH equation valid (cm). Default NULL (nothing added). new_sample_size number measurements allometry calibrated. Default NULL (nothing added). new_unit_dbh character string unit DBH equation (either cm, mm inch). Default "cm". new_unit_output character string unit equation output (either "g", "kg", "Mg" "lbs" output mass, "m" output height). new_input_var independent variable(s) needed allometry. Default "DBH", option "DBH, H". new_output_var dependent variable estimated allometry. Default "Total aboveground biomass". use_height_allom logical value. allodb use Bohn et al. (2014) European sites. User need provide height allometry needed calculate AGB. Default TRUE.

text: genus character value, containing genus (e.g. "Quercus") tree. coords numeric vector length 2 longitude latitude. species character value, containing species (e.g. "rubra") tree. Default "NULL", species identification available. new_eqtable Optional. equation table created new_equations() function. Default original allodb equation table. wna numeric vector, parameter used weight_allom() function determine dbh-related sample-size related weights attributed equations without specified dbh range sample size, respectively. Default 0.1. w95 numeric vector, parameter used weight_allom() function determine value sample-size-related weight reaches 95% maximum value (max=1). Default 500. nres number resampled values. Default "1e4".

title: Attribute weights to equations — weight_allom
text: equation given weight function weight_allom(), calculated product following components: (1) sample-size weight, calculated : $$1-exp(-n*(log(20)/w95))$$ n sample size equation; weight given equations sample size information determined argument wna (0.1 default). (2) climate weight, based similarity climatic conditions equation site target location, using three-letter system Koppen's climate scheme. Climate weights associated combination two Koppen climates provided data("koppenMatrix"). resulting weight value 1e-6 (different climate groups) 1 (exactly climate classification). equation calibrated trees several locations different Koppen climates, maximum value pairwise equation-site climate weights used. (3) taxonomic weight: equal 1 species equations, 0.8 genus equations, 0.5 family equations equations calibrated broad functional taxonomic group (e.g. shrubs, conifers, angiosperms). equations given low taxonomic weight 1e-6: equations significant relative weight final prediction specific equation available.
